scenes.location: KHAO SAN ROAD. NIGHT./ INT. BARS AND SHOPS. NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BANGKOK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A single headlamp in close up shines directly and brightl out. Extreme noise and light. Beyond its glare can be seen the outline of a motorized  tricycle ("tuk-tud") and its Thai driver. A young man, Richard, sits in the back, his rucksack besi him, swaying with the motion of the vehicle. He is worn a sweating. They travel through nocturnal Bangkok: fleets of tuk-tuks taxis, road works, food vendors, dogs, tourists. Music and credits.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KHAO SAN ROAD. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The bright headlight comes to a halt.  Richard climbs down from the tuk-tuk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you hit Bangkok, there's really only  one place to go. The street is busy, full of Thai's and travelers.  Richard picks his way through the crowd, his rucksack on back. He absorbs the scene as he passes boarding houses and hot and the shops and stalls selling food, clothes, pirated  tapes, jewelry, travel tickets, and international phone  calls. Restaurants are filled with western travelers watc American films or European sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The Khao San Road is a decompression  chamber between east and west. It's where  you learn to breathe car fumes and  tropical air for the very first time, or  else carefully rearrange your memories  before you catch your flight home. Richard is approached by a young male Thai Hustler who wa backwards in front of him while making his pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need somewhere to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be OK, Thanks. Richard politely ignores each of his subsequent offers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Sell your passport? Buy  passport? Airline tickets? You want silk?  I'll take you to the best silk place? You  get a suit in twenty-four hours. Diamonds? You want to come with me, you get present  for your girlfriend. Maybe no girlfriend.  You want a girl, no problem. Good time.  Boy girl fucking no problem. You want to  drink some snake blood? At this last one Richard stops and addresses the Hustler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks on, the hustler fading out behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HUSTLER
dialogues.text: You want designer clothes? I get you  Versache, Gucci, Armani, no problem. You  want a camera, all the best makes: Nikon,  Leica, Canon I can get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's all here: you an phone home,  meet up with strangers, split up with  your friends, watch Hollywood movies  while you sip Budweiser and eat a burger  or get some massage and green chicken  soup. You could be anywhere in the world  but you could only find it here. And what  do they want, all these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various young travelers, male and female, in snapshot  exerpts, address their comments to the camera or each oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did it cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A complete rip off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many people. There's a much better  place along the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going exploring. We've read this  book. It tells us all the best places to explore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a place that everyone says is  really unspoiled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard they built a big hotel there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some sort of sewage problem, apparently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going anyway: all the rooms have  got air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for me it's all about finding out  something about a place, and something  about yourself. And when you get off the beaten track, that's where you find out  what there is to find out. Richard turns into one of the restaurants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant extends deeply back away from the street.  Richard passes many diners not dissimilar to himself. Som are talking, many are engrossed in the video entertainmen At the back he reaches a reception desk where he drops hi pack. A Thai female HOTEL RECEPTIONIST sits behind the desk. Sh immediately shows Richard a "menu" of available rooms. Th menu offers a spread of prices for  single/double/window/fan/aircon/bathroom. Richard points to the cheapest combination and hands over 300 bath. The Receptionist becomes aware that he is being started a A worn, disheveled man in his mid-thirties is standing at the nearby bar, a bottle in his hand, studying Richard. T is Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. Daffy says nothing but continues to stare and takes a dri Richard will not be stared down. Neither turns away. The Receptionist passes over a key and smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Thailand. Richard turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INT SHOWER. NIGHT
dialogues.text: In a small windowless shower room, Richard stands  motionless, eyes closed, facing with pleasure the spray o cold water.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The sound of the shower can be heard through a door marke with a shower sign. The sound stops and the door is opened. Richard emerges  with a towel wrapped around his waist, carrying his key a washbag. He walks the short distance to his room. He puts the key the door but the lock is stiff and he has to fiddle with bent over and dripping water on the floor. While he is doing so, the sound of footsteps climbing nea stairs can be heard. There is the sound of a loud wolf-whistle. Richard turns to the source of the whistle. A beautiful European woman is smiling at him. This is  Francoise. She approaches and takes the key from his hand She turns the key in one direction, then the other, while twisting the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Et voila. The door swings gently open. She stands back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Footsteps approach from the stairs. Francoise is joined by a young man, ETIENNE, who catches with her. He nods at Richard as he takes her arm. They wa away from Richard to the next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonsoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh - bonsoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. The couple reach their door. They enter their room and th door is closed behind them. Alone in the corridor again, Richard contemplates their  presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was traveling alone for two reasons.  First of all, being alone allows you more  opportunity to absorb your experiences on  a personal level. Secondly, and this I  felt acutely at that moment, there was no  one who wanted to go with me.

dialogues.speaker: INT RESTAURANT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Richard is in the restaurant which is quiet now. He is alone at a table eating and drinking. On a high she several feet away a Hollywood action film, all gunshots,  car chases, and explosions, plays on the television. Most of the tables around him are empty. Richard is interrupted by the man he met earlier, Daffy, pulls up a chair beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Daffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry to bother you but I  was wondering if you could help me  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah; just ten or fifteen dollars maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting on some money coming through.  It's just that at the moment, you know,  I'm short. They're going to chuck me out.  On the street in Bangkok, that's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry but I just arrived; I'm  on a pretty tight budget myself. I just  can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just five dollars, please.  He leans in close to Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll share something with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't lend you any money. Daffy retreats. Richard turns back to the video and his food. Daffy approaches two young women sitting at a nearby tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ladies, is there any chance you  could help me out. I'm down on my luck at  the moment. The two young women seem uncomfortable. Richard notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If you could see your way to lending me some cash -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. He leans across and holds out a ten dollar note for Daffy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Thank you. I promise I  will repay you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it, OK. Daffy takes it. Richard returns to the video as a big yellow explosion is reflected on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some light enters from the street through a small window. Richard lies on his bed, watching the fan rotate above hi He is listening to the sound of Etienne and Francoise  engaging in noisy sex. They reach the climax of their  activity and fall silent. Richard just has time to enjoy the silence when a new  disturbance begins, this time from the next room in the  other direction. It is a man, Daffy, banging on the wall  just above Richard's head and shouting in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have. You. Got. Anything. To. Smoke. Have. You. Got. Anything. To. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard knocks sharply on the door of Daffy's room. The door is opened immediately by Daffy, looking even wor then before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't have anything to smoke. Daffy stares at him for a moment. Recognition dawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. You're the guy that lent me the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. Now could you be quiet  so I can get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten dollars. I'll find a way to pay you  back. How would you like to know About  somewhere special? The perfect beach.  Paradise. No one else knows about it.  That's got to be worth something. What do  you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I don't care about the money right  now: I just want some sleep. So if you  could be quiet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, OK. I will be, I will be, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Richard turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard - He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Been nice knowing you. He sticks his hand out. Richard politely reciprocates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant fronts on to the street where a new day's  activity is beginning. Richard watches this as he eats his breakfast. He notices Etienne and Francoise sit down at the next tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope our noise did not keep you awake. Richard looks from one to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise? Don't worry. You're on holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means your neighbor. The Scotsman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that noise! Yes, he certainly did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We moved rooms because of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to borrow money from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What idiot would lend him money? It would  disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said if we lent him money h would tell us about a secret beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on an island that no one get to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has been there, off course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was ridiculous; all this at three  o'clock in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be nice though, if there was a  place like that. You know, that no one  could get to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, but look; all these people. If  that place existed, they'd all be there.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAVEL AGENT'S. DAY
dialogues.text: On a large board are details, photographs and prices of  various standard excursions. A Thai TRAVEL AGENT reels th off at great speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nakhon - Pathom - Phra Ptahom Chedi -  Damnoen Sadual floating market - eight  hundred baht. Kanchanburi - Erwan national  Park Phrathat Cave, huang Khamin Falls -  six hundred baht. Nam Tok, hellfire Pass,  Three Pagodas, Sai Yok National Park -  fifteen hundred baht. Bang Pa In Royal  Palace, Ayatthaya, Wat Phra Manhathat,  Wat Raburna - one thousand baht. What do  you want? Richard studies the board but is not excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty Marlboro light, please. Instantly the Travel Agent produces the packet of cigaret from a shelf and lays them on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard lights up and looks around. He looks through the tapes at a stall.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR. DAY
dialogues.text: Richard walks along the corridor towards his room, his ne tape playing on his walkman. On his door, a folded sheet of paper is attached with a p Richard lifts it off and unfolds it. It is a detailed and carefully drawn map of a cluster of  islands. Some are named. One is unnamed. On it, some feat are marked; hills, forest, river and a letter X. In the corner it reads "X = beach". Richard switches his Walkman off. He studies the map then walks to Daffy's door and knocks. No reply. Richard twists the handle and pushes gently. The door ope

dialogues.speaker: INT DAFFY'S ROOM. DAY.
dialogues.text: The room is dim, be even so the blood can be seen sprayed and smeared around the walls, sheets and floor. There is no sign of Daffy. Richard treads carefully, avoiding the pools of blood on floor. He reaches the other side of the room. There, wedged in t narrow gap between bed and wall, is Daffy's corpse. His  wrists have been cut. Richard studies the map again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hope and you dream, but you never  believe that something's going to happen  for you, not like it does in the movies.  And when it does, you sort of expect it  to feel different. More visceral. More  real. Like IMAX maybe. I was waiting for  it to hit me, but it didn't. And just for the record, I never did get my ten  dollars back. Richard switches his walkman back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an office, two policemen, one in UNIFORM and the other a DETECTIVE, stand over Richard while he signs a statemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police didn't want to waste any time  on it. They were just pissed off because  he was traveling on a false passport, name  of Mr. Daffy Duck, birthplace Ruritania,  which kind of fucked up all the paperwork. They pulled everyone in from the hotel,  but all they wanted form me was a  statement saying I found him and it looked  like he cut his wrists. No problem. The detective studies Richard's passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in Thailand? Tourist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to Patpong? See smoke from pussy,  ping pong ball from pussy, razor blade  from pussy; bird from pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Thai girls best in the world.  Thai food best in the world. Thai dope  best in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know anything about that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: INT. POLICE STATION CORRIDOR. DAY
dialogues.text: The door of the office opens and Richard walks out. Lined up in the corridor, slouching against the walls, ar several other travelers from the hotel. At the front of t queue are Francoise and Etienne. The officer beckons Etienne into the office and closes th door. Richard and Francoise acknowledge each other with a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is seated at the top of his bed, addressing his  speech out of shot while he holds the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, this island may not actually exist.  And even if it does, we might not be able  to get there. But look at it like this:  what else is there to do around here? Richard is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So what do you think? Are you going to  come or not. I'd be thrilled if you'd join  me, you and yourВ…you and your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR. DAY
dialogues.text: Richard knocks on his neighbors' door. Etienne opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You want to take a hike? I mean a trip.  A journey. With your girlfriend and me. I  mean the two of you, and me. It's a secret  island. Paradise. You know the kind of  thing I'm talking about. Francoise appears behind Etienne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. Here, take a look. He shows Etienne the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's a map. The dead guy left it for me;  I think it's the place he tried to sell  you. It's going to be just fucking great.  You want to come? I'd be thrilled if... Francoise and Etienne are looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized that I had absolutely no idea  of how I was going to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train travels at night alongside fields.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAIN. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Richard is awake. Opposite him, Etienne and Francoise are slumped together in sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Etienne, however, and I have to hand it  to the guy, was fucking great. He  organized the whole thing: tickets,  timetables, best route, the whole damn  trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bow of a passenger ferry crashes through a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decks are crowded with travelers and their packs. Amo them are Richard, Francoise, and Etienne. Maps and guideb are being studied by many. The noise of the engines and t wind deters conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to him we hit the final stop on  the tourist trail inside twenty-four hours, where, Etienne assured me, we would hire what he called a "local fisherman" to  take us on the last stage of our journey.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRUCK. DAY
dialogues.text: Inside back of a covered, converted pick-up, four people seated down each side, amongst them Richard, Francoise, a Etienne. Behind them as they bump along, can be seen the dusty red road bordered with dense green shrubs. The truck stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard unloads the final of the three rucksacks from the roof of the truck, passing it down to Etienne who stands the back with Francoise. The truck pulls away, revealing as sign, "Seashell  Bungalows".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple wooden shack on stilts, one of several standing a line at the edge of the beach. There is a small porch t the front.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BUNGALOW. DAY
dialogues.text: A spartan room: bed, mosquito nets, chair, cupboard, fan. Richard dumps his rucksack. Ext. SEA/BEACH. DAY.  A long inflatable tube is towed past by a motorboat, its  passengers whooping with delight. As it passes, Francoise is revealed, standing in the wate looking in towards the shore. She begins to walk in. On the beach there are sunbathers, games of beach volley  ball, and vendors selling food and sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was just the kind of place I didn't  want to hang around. Not that it's lacking  in comfort. Quite the opposite. It's got  everything. Everything you could possibly  need to make you feel at home. And what's the point of that. On the beach Francoise picks up a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant fronts on to the beach. At the back there a bar. Richard sits alone at a table with a drink, watching the  scene on the beach, including Francoise. Etienne pulls up a chair and sits down. Francoise will join them as the dialogue proceeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's arranged. Tomorrow morning. Eight  hundred bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one problem. Etienne opens the map on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will not take us to the island. It's  in the National Park and it is forbidden  to go there. But we are allowed to travel to this one to stay for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the wrong one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. Francoise sits down with a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So from there to there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leave our rucksacks on this island and  then we swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course I can swim. How far do you  think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One or two kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Great. Not far at all. I don't like  to be negative, but do you think we should  let someone know where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to swim "one or two  kilometers" across open sea, from one  uninhabited island to another. Something  goes wrong. What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you told someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a bad idea to tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, it's secret. That's the whole  point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK. Forget it. We won't tell anyone. Richard picks up the map

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BUNGALOW. DAY
dialogues.text: Richard sits on his veranda, under cover. Beyond him is a tropical downpour. He hears two sets of footsteps rushing up the stairs of t next door bungalow. Two men, Americans, Zeph and Sammy, t to open their door but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, I knew we locked it. We should have  left it unlocked. Sammy addresses Richard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost our key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you lose it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beach. Or in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is we don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try reception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed. Back later. We hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty annoying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disaster, to which there is only  one sensible, considered, appropriate,  and timely response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three are stoned. A joint is passed around while Zeph sings badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smoke two joints in the morning, and I  smoke two joints at night, and I smoke  two joints in the afternoon, and then I  feel alright. I smoke two joints in time  of peace, and two in time of war. I smoke  two joints before I smoke two joints and  then I smoke some more. I can't remember  the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you smoked too much dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the Kentucky friend mouse story?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman bites chicken leg, turns out to be  a mouse. Or a rat. It's an urban myth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Always happened to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's an urban myth, well more of a  rural myth, going around here at the  moment. It's about a beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea. This beach is perfect. It's on an  island, right, hidden from the sea.  Imagine: pure white sand and enough dope  to smoke all day every day for the rest  of your life. Only a few know exactly  where it is and they won't tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course no one's actually ever met any  of these people, only met someone who has.  You know what I mean. It's a Kentucky  fried mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't heard that one before. But it's  good. It's a good story. A torch shines on them, jolting them into some sort of  reaction and a woman's voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you! I got your key!

dialogues.speaker: INT. BUNGALOW. DAY
dialogues.text: Richard's rucksack is packed an by the door. Richard is sitting copying Daffy's map on to another shee of paper. He finishes and writes a note on the copy. He puts the original in his pack and lifts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard hops over the fence to the veranda of Zeph and  Sammy's bungalow. He slips the folded copy under their door. He looks around to check that he has not been seen.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: Richard walks along a narrow wooden pontoon, his rucksack his back. He stops about half way along at a small narrow wooden bo with an outboard motor. He looks down into it. Etienne and Francoise walk past him along the pontoon wit stopping and disappear from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, let's face it. There is no such thing  as a local fisherman anymore. There really  isn't the demand for them. If you want to catch fish you put down a hundred  kilometer drag net. Richard walks away along the pontoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And if you want to go somewhere - you get  a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Francoise and Etienne sit at the back of a small powerful motor launch which skims across the surface of t sea with great noise and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motor launch idles gently as it drifts into the shall of a small deserted bay. Richard Francoise, and Etienne jump from the boat into th shallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun sets they sit in silence, each shoveling down  forkloads of noodles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only sounds are those of crickets and the waves gentl breaking on the shore. Richard is lying asleep on the sand. He is woken by someone rummaging through the rucksack bes him. It is Francoise, removing clothes, books, souvenirs. Eventually she finds her camera, a mini-tripod and a  cable-release. She places them on an unfolded T-shirt on the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francoise -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshh. Etienne will be angry if I wake him.  He thinks I waste film taking photographs  of the sky. Richard wakes up and works out what she is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night I will get the perfect  photograph. She presses the cable release.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCOISE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq, six. She lets the shutter close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Take a look. Richard leans over and squints down the viewfinder. The sky is framed. Francoise leans into the frame. Richard draws back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize that in the eternity of space,  there is a planet, just like this one,  where you are photographing back towards  us. You're photographing yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are infinite worlds out there,  where anything that can happen does happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So on one you are rich, on another poor.  On one you are a murderer, on another the  victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, you know something -  She hands him the cable release while she adjusts the cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That is just the kind of pretentious  bullshit that Englishmen and Americans  always say to French girls so that they  can sleep with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I thought I was doing quite well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the sky, Richard.  She presses his thumb down on the cable release, her hand around his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq, six, septВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francoise voice fades away over an image of the night sky Time lapse: the sky rapidly changes to day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you develop an infatuation for  someone, you always find a reason to believe that this is exactly the person  for you. It doesn't need to be a good  reason, a bad one will do just as well.  Taking photographs of the night sky, for  example: in the long run that's just the  kind of dumb irritating habit that would  cause you to split up. But at the time -  it's the charming eccentricity you've  been searching for all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a different beach they look towards their target: th island. It is 1-2 kilometers away. Richard, Etienne, and Francoise stand on the beach lookin towards it. Each is in their swimwear and a T-shirt, and  carries a plastic bag, inflated and tied, in which they  carry their valuables and some rations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kilometer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - I'm American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think in miles, not kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how many miles do you think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea but it looks like a long  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's too far, then we'll drown. But if  we donВ’t try then we'll never know. Richard wades into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to enjoy a moment like that. You  just don't know, you see; it may never  happen again. Once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SO, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am such a fucking hero. "Let's go". I  felt like I'd waited all my life just to  say something like that. So I replayed it  a couple of times, taking it from  different perspectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multiple repeats of Richard's moment from various  perspectives and speeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So: let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to enjoy a moment like that. You  just don't know, you see: it may never  happen again. Once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So: let's go.  He dives in and begins swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are far out to sea now, several hundred meters from  the shore. Richard swims at the front, the other two about five mete behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're about half way. A few strokes later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard - I saw a fin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fin! They all stop and tread water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shark fin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, just a fin. Over there.  About a hundred meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what the fuck do you expect me to do  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just thought you ought to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well to be honest, Etienne, I would rather  have not known about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit fucking late. He starts swimming again. A few strokes later he hears a short sharp scream from  Francoise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francoise! Francoise! Richard turns around. Francoise is gone. Her plastic bag  bobs on the surface. Etienne is frantic, hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Etienne submerges briefly and resurfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just went under the water. She was  pulled under. Oh God, I don't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there a shark? Did you see a shark? They both start looking down at their feet and circling  frantically in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I don't know! Oh God. Suddenly Richard screams. Francoise surfaces, pulling up his ankle. She and Etienne laugh at Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. You Europeans, you have such  a playful sense of humor. No wonder your  comedy has conquered the world. He swims on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Moliere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. He swims on without looking round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one the three swimmers emerge from the sea and  collapse on the beach. They are absolutely exhausted and  lie there on the sand, unable to speak. Eventually, they tear open their plastic bags, drink some water and eat some chocolate. Richard has a little water left in his bottle. He notices Francoise and Etienne eyeing it enviously. He holds the bottle out towards them, then snatches it ba and swigs down the last of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, Francoise, and Etienne walk through the forest  behind the beach.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FOREST. DAY
dialogues.text: They scramble up a steep slope through dense foliage.  Richard, at the front, pauses to let the other two pass h then he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard reaches the top of the slope and follows the othe two through a gap in the foliage. He joins Etienne and Francoise who are standing in awe at the edge of a large clearing filled with cannabis plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice Island. They smile and examine the plants. Richard wanders a short distance away. Something glinting on the ground catches Richard's eye. H leans down and picks it up. It is an empty brass cartridg from a rifle. Richard looks around. Just ahead he sees the remains of an extinguished campfir and beyond that, protruding from the undergrowth, a pair male legs and beyond them, the butt of a rifle. CLOSE IN on the nest in the undergrowth. The legs and gun belong to a Farmer. He is asleep. His physique is strong  and his skin weathered. Richard turns back to Etienne and Francoise. They are sti strolling amongst the plants. Richard begins to back away. The Farmer wakes. He lifts his gun and stands up to look out over the dope  field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmer looks around, sees nobody. His attention is  attracted by a whistle. He looks over. A group of three more, similarly armed  Farmers emerge from the forest at the other side. He waves at them. They beckon him across. He sets off through the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three intruders continue to crawl along the ground  between the plants. Suddenly Richard stops. The farmer's footsteps come close His feet pass in the gap between Richard and Francoise. H pauses. They lie frozen in place. He lights a cigarette a drops the match. He moves on. They breath again. TO BE CONTINUED...
